description: From bride +‎ -s- +‎ maid. Sports/entertainment sense: in reference to the saying always a bridesmaid, never a bride.

entries.meaning: A woman who attends a bride during her wedding ceremony, as part of the main wedding party.
examples: I'd love to be your bridesmaid at the wedding.

entries.meaning: (sports, entertainment) A person or team that perennially finishes well, but never first.

verbs.description: bridesmaid (third-person singular simple present bridesmaids, present participle bridesmaiding, simple past and past participle bridesmaided)

entries.meaning: To act as a bridesmaid for; to attend a bride during her wedding ceremony.
examples: And what's this? that isn't Herbie Frost with you in the canoe ; why he was best man when I bridesmaided Corinne.
